ChestSLStandingChestDip.name: Sled Standing Chest Dip
ChestSLStandingChestDip.preparation: Stand between handles facing machine. Bend forward slightly and grasp parallel handles with oblique grip. Position elbows upward and outward. Bend knees just enough to raise selected weight up from remaining weight stack.
ChestSLStandingChestDip.execution: Push lever down by straightening arms. Return lever up with elbows flaring out until chest is slightly stretched. Repeat.
ChestSLStandingChestDip.comments: This particular machine design is rare. See typical dip machines Lever Dip Machine ALever Dip Machine B(video)Lever Dip Machine C Also seedip grip position.
ChestSLStandingChestDip.synergists: latissimusdorsi, pectoralisclavicular, tricepsbrachii, levatorscapulae, teresmajor, deltoidanterior, pectoralisminor, rhomboids

ChestSLStandingChestDipWideHorizontalGri.name: Sled Horizontal Grip Standing Chest Dip
ChestSLStandingChestDipWideHorizontalGri.preparation: Stand between handles facing machine. Bend forward slightly and grasp transverse handles with overhand grip. Position elbows upward and outward. Bend knees just enough to raise selected weight up from remaining weight stack.
ChestSLStandingChestDipWideHorizontalGri.execution: Push lever down by straightening arms. Return lever up with elbows flaring out until chest is slightly stretched. Repeat.
ChestSLStandingChestDipWideHorizontalGri.comments: Both the machine design and handle orientation are rare. See typical dip machines Lever Dip Machine ALever Dip Machine B(video)Lever Dip Machine C Also seedip grip position.
ChestSLStandingChestDipWideHorizontalGri.synergists: latissimusdorsi, pectoralisclavicular, tricepsbrachii, levatorscapulae, teresmajor, deltoidanterior, pectoralisminor, rhomboids
